commit_message:
Don't allow POST requests to the static files

Fuel web is an actually the one page JavaScript based application so
all the POST requests handled by the APIs via AJAX requests.

Change-Id: Iaddad9eb7b13e6a7e590265fe248d27d3ec2b96c
Closes-Bug: #1632701
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Replace opensatck-terracotta with openstack-nimble in gerritbot channels

As we are at our limits of channels we can serve with one gerritbot client,
We would like to replace openstack-terracotta with openstack-nimble here to
make Nimble project get notifications from gerrit. This has been approved
by Terracotta PTL.

Change-Id: Id161ccd4068f519b5d3934a09249e4d8c80f1ca6

commit_message:
Pre-allocate trunk adapter on target host

This change will allocate the trunk adapter on the target server as part
of its live migration command when paired with OVS.

This reduces the amount of down time when running a live migration with
Open vSwitch as the VIF type.

Closes-Bug: #1632366

Change-Id: I43f06ecd827bb1d08636c6e53efcad292d827b20

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-12 16:29:34.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/keystone-ssh/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/keystone/keystone-fernet/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/keystone-fernet.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/ssh_config.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/id_rsa.pub', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/id_rsa', 'docker/keystone/keystone-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/fernet-rotate.sh.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/sshd_config.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/fernet-node-sync.sh.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/crontab.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/keystone-ssh.json.j2'], 'message': 'Fix keystone fernet file exchange via ssh

* install openssh client in keystone-fernet container
* install rsync in keystone-ssh container
* fix syntax issue in ssh configuration
* copy ssh configuration into keystone-fernet container
* copy id_rsa.pub into keystone-ssh container
* copy id_rsa into keystone-fernet container
* use full path to ssh binary in used scripts
* add missing newlines at EOF
* when using type source set /var/lib/keystone as home
  directory for the user keystone

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: Id6b41030056a69f6516a054beb2fc0e08226e876
Closes-bug: #1623013
'}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone fernet file exchange via ssh

* install openssh client in keystone-fernet container
* install rsync in keystone-ssh container
* fix syntax issue in ssh configuration
* copy ssh configuration into keystone-fernet container
* copy id_rsa.pub into keystone-ssh container
* copy id_rsa into keystone-fernet container
* use full path to ssh binary in used scripts
* add missing newlines at EOF
* when using type source set /var/lib/keystone as home
  directory for the user keystone

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: Id6b41030056a69f6516a054beb2fc0e08226e876
Closes-bug: #1623013

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-12 17:28:35.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/set_configs.py', 'ansible/roles/rabbitmq/templates/rabbitmq.json.j2'], 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq upgrade permission issue

During the upgrade from Mitaka to Newton, the uid/gid may change for the
same image. Especially on Ubuntu, we moved to Ubuntu Xenial in Newton
and it added systemd related user which break all the uid/gid during an
upgrade. It will the permissions in all docker named volumes.

This fix extends set_config.py to set the proper permission during
container start. This is super light then add commands in
extend_start.sh file  or add ansible tasks.

This patch just fixes rabbitmq case. Other services will be fixed in
following patches.

Partial-Bug: #1631503
Change-Id: Ib17027b97abbc9bf4e3cd503601b8010325b5c5b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq upgrade permission issue

During the upgrade from Mitaka to Newton, the uid/gid may change for the
same image. Especially on Ubuntu, we moved to Ubuntu Xenial in Newton
and it added systemd related user which break all the uid/gid during an
upgrade. It will the permissions in all docker named volumes.

This fix extends set_config.py to set the proper permission during
container start. This is super light then add commands in
extend_start.sh file  or add ansible tasks.

This patch just fixes rabbitmq case. Other services will be fixed in
following patches.

Partial-Bug: #1631503
Change-Id: Ib17027b97abbc9bf4e3cd503601b8010325b5c5b

subject: Delegate from first available compute host
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-13 00:45:52.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_compute_key_distribute.yml'], 'message': "Delegate from first available compute host

The 'Drop authorized keys file script locally' task shouldn't
specifically require that the first member of the nova_compute group be
available. If the playbook is run with a limit excluding that host, the
task will always end up being skipped.

Use an intersect filter to find the first available compute host within
the play and use that as the delegation host.

Closes-Bug: 1632447
Change-Id: Id12fd6cee104a6fb705acc66704f21d629694d84
"}]
commit_message:
Delegate from first available compute host

The 'Drop authorized keys file script locally' task shouldn't
specifically require that the first member of the nova_compute group be
available. If the playbook is run with a limit excluding that host, the
task will always end up being skipped.

Use an intersect filter to find the first available compute host within
the play and use that as the delegation host.

Closes-Bug: 1632447
Change-Id: Id12fd6cee104a6fb705acc66704f21d629694d84

commit_message:
Rework Identity LDAP structure

This content has three sections - two of which are shown on a different
level which looks rather awkward.

Move content to setup LDAP server in separate file and reference it
properly.

Fix also a wrong headline markup and indent.

Rename identity-secure-identity-to-ldap-backend.rst to
identity-secure-ldap-backend.rst. Adjust htaccess for that.

Change-Id: I1a822304f1232211cc32f1b4553417dc2ccfeb45

commit_message:
Clean rc from unit tests

Magnum have removed the k8s rc apis, but have not removed it from
policy.json. The patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384064/)
remove rc from etc/magnum/policy.json.

And we should remove rc from tests/fake_policy.py.

commit_message:
Fix issue with not removing rbd rescue disk

Currently when instance that use RBD as backend
is rescued and next unrescued, rescue image is
not removed, this cause issue when the same
instance is rescued again it's use old rescue
image not new one.

Change-Id: Idf4086303baa4b936c90be89552ad8deb45cef3a
Closes-Bug: #1475652

commit_message:
Update amulet test definitions

- Add Xenial-Newton Amulet test definitions (dev).

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions (dev).

- Use the KSV3 version of the Amulet test for smoke instead of KSV2.

- Use the percona-cluster charm in tests instead of the mysql charm.

Newton tests are not enabled yet, per existing blocker:
- https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-barbican-softhsm/+bug/1611393

Change-Id: I7ccc075677bcc1a8d2f6f0eed5ef0d46f4cbbfc8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}, {'_account_id': 9459, 'name': '.Haifeng Yan', 'email': 'yanheven@qq.com', 'username': 'yan'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 22752, 'name': 'Hanxi Liu', 'email': 'apolloliuhx@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hanxi_Liu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-12 11:54:51.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Fix wrong usage of DuplicateOptError

DuplicateOptError only accepts option name as constructor parameter,
but we pass instance of argparse.ArgumentError, which is wrong.
Raising DuplicateOptError is part of public API, so we can't expose
other exceptions, but make the error messag meaningful.

Change-Id: I73e29fd2be990b79bc439d09c903b015745460d3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong usage of DuplicateOptError

DuplicateOptError only accepts option name as constructor parameter,
but we pass instance of argparse.ArgumentError, which is wrong.
Raising DuplicateOptError is part of public API, so we can't expose
other exceptions, but make the error messag meaningful.

Change-Id: I73e29fd2be990b79bc439d09c903b015745460d3

commit_message:
Fix for the exception on creating secondary zone

While creating secondary zone, we are getting exception
"Failed to determine zone id for synchronized operation".
This code will fix the broken code and avoid exception.

Change-Id: I972188178f78e2f34e312fa0a03b3a11fc0b9fd7
Closes-Bug: #1626212

commit_message:
Fix the config args of kubernetes service

Many parameters of magnum templates use '_' instead of '-', but
all the args of kubernetes service use '-'. So let's format the
parameters.

Change-Id: I80b356f2b853008e18edce3123add89b8ef7ea26

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-11 07:06:10.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/swift/proxy.pp'], 'message': 'Add versioned_writes to Swift proxy config

Tempest expects object versioning to be enabled by default in Swift;
if not it has to be disabled explicitly in the Tempest config.

This is a commonly used middleware, therefore it should be enabled
in the overcloud proxy nodes as well.

Closes-Bug: 1632215
Change-Id: I07a206473ff7939749e3eba1dfe3ea8c4526eb5c
'}]
commit_message:
Add versioned_writes to Swift proxy config

Tempest expects object versioning to be enabled by default in Swift;
if not it has to be disabled explicitly in the Tempest config.

This is a commonly used middleware, therefore it should be enabled
in the overcloud proxy nodes as well.

Closes-Bug: 1632215
Change-Id: I07a206473ff7939749e3eba1dfe3ea8c4526eb5c

commit_message:
Fixed cotyledon version requirement

There is a minimum version requirement of cotyledon for
ceilometer-collector to work properly. We need to make sure it's above
version 1.2.4.

Change-Id: I07276d032f7f8849501f94f9577833c1d9b68131
Closes-Bug: #1632925

commit_message:
Add networking-manila to contrib

networking-manila contains a simple neutron ML2 mechanism driver.
This driver can fulfill port bindigs in a generic way and therefore
enables drivers that only do partial bindings and works with neutron
at the gate.

Co-Authored-By: Andrew Battye <andrew.battye@sap.com>
Co-Authored-By: Marc Koderer <marc@koderer.com>
Partly-implements: bp manila-hpb-support

Change-Id: I01031fb14cfd5e088dc130e5884f4e8871449d26

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-01 15:46:48.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Allow devstack plugins in contrib folder

This patch extends the manila devstack plugin to allow additional
devstack plugins to live in the contrib directory.

It does that by forwarding calls to plugin.sh and settings of the manila
devstack plugin to all devstack plugins that can be found in contrib.

This is needed because the devstack plugin mechanism does only allow for
a single devstack plugin which lives in the top level directory of the
repository. To support additional devstack plugins in contrib the manila
devstack plugin must invoke those plugins itself.

Change-Id: Ic81688ac978c2a377f804ef761906436360eed75
'}]
commit_message:
Allow devstack plugins in contrib folder

This patch extends the manila devstack plugin to allow additional
devstack plugins to live in the contrib directory.

It does that by forwarding calls to plugin.sh and settings of the manila
devstack plugin to all devstack plugins that can be found in contrib.

This is needed because the devstack plugin mechanism does only allow for
a single devstack plugin which lives in the top level directory of the
repository. To support additional devstack plugins in contrib the manila
devstack plugin must invoke those plugins itself.

Change-Id: Ic81688ac978c2a377f804ef761906436360eed75

revisions:

Do not show versions 2.0.0 in  the Newton release notes - see
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/mistral/newton.html

This adds the earliest-version directive to only show the Newton release
which was 3.0.0.

Also, do not generate an index file, it is empty, see:

Change-Id: I295266c761d0d8f1fc6f8459f6c77e7e230de186
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup Newton Release Notes

Do not show versions 2.0.0 in  the Newton release notes - see
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/mistral/newton.html

This adds the earliest-version directive to only show the Newton release
which was 3.0.0.

Also, do not generate an index file, it is empty, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/mistral/genindex.html

Change-Id: I295266c761d0d8f1fc6f8459f6c77e7e230de186

commit_message:
Publish/output in case of task/workflow failure

Currently it is not possible to provide any reasonable output in case of
a task or workflow failure. Implementing this would greatly simplify error
handling in workflows. This blueprint is a proposal to introduce two new
attributes, publish-on-error for tasks and output-on-error for workflows
for this purpose.

Implements: blueprint mistral-publish-on-error
Change-Id: Ib3a64971effb02390206dc6f993e772a51f8f237

commit_message:
Add HAProxy TLS handled by certmonger as composable service

This adds some basic pieces to get certmonger to manage the
certificates for HAProxy. The aim is to be flexible enough that we
will be able to manage both public and internal certificates.

This also adds a relevant environment to get the endpoints to have
TLS everywhere.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Depends-On: I89001ae32f46c9682aecc118753ef6cd647baa62
Change-Id: Ife5f8c2f07233295bc15b4c605acf3d9bd62f162

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-10-07 18:03:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/drivers/oneview.rst'], 'message': "Clarify when oneview node can be managed by ironic

This change intends to warn the cloud administrators that the
driver/ironic can control the power state of the OneView nodes, and
thus can revert any user's action. This will not happen in case the
machine has a server profile assigned by another OneView user. Therefore,
the information was added to the OneView driver's documentation.

Change-Id: I08d8d454fe5da66892978ae052e8ce548dc35777
"}]
owner_name: Charlle Daniel Da Silva Vieira Dias
commit_message:
Clarify when oneview node can be managed by ironic

This change intends to warn the cloud administrators that the
driver/ironic can control the power state of the OneView nodes, and
thus can revert any user's action. This will not happen in case the
machine has a server profile assigned by another OneView user. Therefore,
the information was added to the OneView driver's documentation.

Change-Id: I08d8d454fe5da66892978ae052e8ce548dc35777

commit_message:
Introduce default_boot_option configuration option

This is the first step to changing the default boot option from netboot to local.
The new configuration allows setting the default boot option globally.

A warning is issued if no explicit value is provided for this configuration.

Change-Id: I3bd4a165fa2ec1105f34bf5a2150da99136ba4a6
Partial-Bug: #1619339

commit_message:
Reduce duplication and complexity in format_dom

In this patchset, I reduced duplicated code lines and complexity
with using already existing methods in LibvirtConfigGuestSysinfo class,
format_dom() method. In this way, fewer if condition is used, which
reduces the complexity of the code.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-26 12:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_config.py'], 'message': "Renamed parameters name in config.py

In LibvirtConfigObject, the parameter's name for the
node is 'name'. Which is a problem, when we want to add
an attribute named 'name' to a DOM node. In this patchset,
the symbolic parameter name for a node's name is changed
from 'name' to 'node_name'. After this change, we can add an
attribute 'name' to our DOM node objects.

Change-Id: I7baaf7f828c3b5ffa3d0bec7e80d348f7f9d1e45
"}]
commit_message:
Renamed parameters name in config.py

In LibvirtConfigObject, the parameter's name for the
node is 'name'. Which is a problem, when we want to add
an attribute named 'name' to a DOM node. In this patchset,
the symbolic parameter name for a node's name is changed
from 'name' to 'node_name'. After this change, we can add an
attribute 'name' to our DOM node objects.

Change-Id: I7baaf7f828c3b5ffa3d0bec7e80d348f7f9d1e45

subject: Change keystone.log's permit to keystone:keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-09 07:28:31.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/keystone/extend_start.sh'], 'message': "Change keystone.log's permit to keystone:keystone

At present, keystone.log's user:group permit is root:kolla,
when got token from keystone, it failed. The reason is that:
Permission denied. So it shoud be changed keystone:keystone.

Change-Id: Ibbbf1d88ba16e5040f9068ea9948373d10593514
Closes-Bug: #1631685
"}]
commit_message:
Change keystone.log's permit to keystone:keystone

At present, keystone.log's user:group permit is root:kolla,
when got token from keystone, it failed. The reason is that:
Permission denied. So it shoud be changed keystone:keystone.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-04 21:32:14.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/netconfig/reserved_ports.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/reserved_ports.pp'], 'message': 'Add qemu migration ports to local reserved ports

Currently qemu default migration ports are not set as local
reserved ports and thus they could be used as local source ports
for connection establishing by other applications. This behaviour
may lead to race conditions during port binding and failures of
live migrations.

This commit adds qemu default port range to the default list
of sysctl local reserved ports

Change-Id: I81b0c6904e5ae4c6d9b58b97c4b4a997e07d748b
Closes-Bug: #1627476
'}]
commit_message:
Add qemu migration ports to local reserved ports

Currently qemu default migration ports are not set as local
reserved ports and thus they could be used as local source ports
for connection establishing by other applications. This behaviour
may lead to race conditions during port binding and failures of
live migrations.

This commit adds qemu default port range to the default list
of sysctl local reserved ports

Change-Id: I81b0c6904e5ae4c6d9b58b97c4b4a997e07d748b
Closes-Bug: #1627476

subject: Update installation guide after the Tricircle splitting
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-10-13 01:43:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/single-node-installation-devstack.rst', 'README.rst', 'doc/source/installation.rst'], 'message': 'Update installation guide after the Tricircle splitting

1. What is the problem?
The current installation guide is based on the Tricircle with
API-GW and networking automation functionalities. After the
Tricircle splitting, only networking automation will be remained
the Tricircle repository, so the current installation guide
will not work anymore.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Update the installation guide to reflect the Tricricle splitting.
This patch will focus on single node installation with DevStack.
Multi-node installation with DevStack will be update in another
patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385306/.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I0d5a3a9673a34ca8eb96a07f2eafbb1b931ef55f
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update installation guide after the Tricircle splitting

1. What is the problem?
The current installation guide is based on the Tricircle with
API-GW and networking automation functionalities. After the
Tricircle splitting, only networking automation will be remained
the Tricircle repository, so the current installation guide
will not work anymore.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Update the installation guide to reflect the Tricricle splitting.
This patch will focus on single node installation with DevStack.
Multi-node installation with DevStack will be update in another
patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385306/.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I0d5a3a9673a34ca8eb96a07f2eafbb1b931ef55f
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Restart mcollective on slave nodes after restore

Also, on the backup step a status of `mco ping` is serialized in an
upgrade tarball and on the restore step it is compared with the actual
status. All nodes that are not respond are logged.

In additional, the status of `mco ping` is archived on the backup step
and is compared on the restore step with the actual ones.

Change-Id: Ibba81102214998d83614a42cdb21c21bebd8284a
Related-Bug: #1561092

subject: Update the dependency in stable/newton branch
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-30 07:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf.node_1.sample', 'devstack/local.conf.sample', 'README.rst', 'tox.ini', 'doc/source/installation.rst', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Update the dependency in stable/newton branch

1. What is the problem
The Tricircle is one project in OpenStack name space, it runs with the
dependency to OpenStack services like Nova, Cinder, Neutron. In the
master branch of the Tricircle, all dependencies are pointed to the
master branch of all OpenStack services, include itself.

When the stable/newton branch of the Tricircle was created, all these
dependencies are not changed, for the master will change now and then,
then the stable/newton branch of the Tricircle will not be able to run
normally as more and more changes happen in the master branch, for
the Tricircle must be changed too to adapt the dependency change, but in
the stable/newton branch, we'll not cherry pick back all these changes
from master to the stable/newton branch.

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the Tricircle stable/newton branch is created, all these
dependencies should be pointed to stable/newton branch.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
No new feature is needed, just update the dependency.

Change-Id: I2c63c5026fbc3d1796f9b2a18a5476d575ae592f
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Update the dependency in stable/newton branch

1. What is the problem
The Tricircle is one project in OpenStack name space, it runs with the
dependency to OpenStack services like Nova, Cinder, Neutron. In the
master branch of the Tricircle, all dependencies are pointed to the
master branch of all OpenStack services, include itself.

When the stable/newton branch of the Tricircle was created, all these
dependencies are not changed, for the master will change now and then,
then the stable/newton branch of the Tricircle will not be able to run
normally as more and more changes happen in the master branch, for
the Tricircle must be changed too to adapt the dependency change, but in
the stable/newton branch, we'll not cherry pick back all these changes
from master to the stable/newton branch.

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the Tricircle stable/newton branch is created, all these
dependencies should be pointed to stable/newton branch.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
No new feature is needed, just update the dependency.

Change-Id: I2c63c5026fbc3d1796f9b2a18a5476d575ae592f
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Restart mcollective on slave nodes after restore

Also, on the backup step a status of `mco ping` is serialized in an
upgrade tarball and on the restore step it is compared with the actual
status. All nodes that are not respond are logged.

In additional, the status of `mco ping` is archived on the backup step
and is compared on the restore step with the actual ones.

Change-Id: Ibba81102214998d83614a42cdb21c21bebd8284a
Related-Bug: #1561092

subject: [AMQP 1.0] Avoid unnecessary thread switch on ack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 14:26:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/controller.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_amqp1.py'], 'message': '[AMQP 1.0] Avoid unnecessary thread switch on ack

Avoid blocking the RPC Server thread when it attempts to acknowledge
the RPC request message.  Blocking is unnecessary as the acknowledge
command does not return a status and can be processed asynchronously
from the server thread.

Avoiding this context switch improves overall RPC call throughput
according to the simulator tool by approximately ten percent on my
test systems.

Change-Id: I71548eb6f9f7dcaf74cb426d4e9b369b54856419
'}]
commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Avoid unnecessary thread switch on ack

Avoid blocking the RPC Server thread when it attempts to acknowledge
the RPC request message.  Blocking is unnecessary as the acknowledge
command does not return a status and can be processed asynchronously
from the server thread.

Avoiding this context switch improves overall RPC call throughput
according to the simulator tool by approximately ten percent on my
test systems.

Change-Id: I71548eb6f9f7dcaf74cb426d4e9b369b54856419

commit_message:
Require WebOb>=1.6.0

Nova change 4e923eb9a660593b8a7d2522992700182978a54c started

tests from Neutron tree. This patch adds introduces such a job for

subject: Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 04:39:53.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_analytics/banana/grammar/base_ast.py', 'monasca_analytics/banana/grammar/ast.py', 'monasca_analytics/ldp/monasca_combine.py', 'monasca_analytics/ldp/monasca_derivative.py', 'test/ldp/test_monasca_aggregator.py', 'monasca_analytics/banana/grammar/config.py', 'monasca_analytics/ldp/monasca_aggregate.py'], 'message': "Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: I5233438a864bb00d04ba7fb2b1688cacb0473691
"}]
commit_message:
Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: I5233438a864bb00d04ba7fb2b1688cacb0473691

subject: Adjust help text of config option rabbit_max_retries
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-29 05:08:34.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Adjust help text of config option rabbit_max_retries

The annotation the link of
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/b0947e57138b97ef18f1451aa900bd476490e502/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py#L684
shows that if rabbit_max_retries = 0, there is no retry
to connect to rabbitmq after disconnection.

In the kombu lib, this two links https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/d9340c1f3b6660c596ee35eba943336e91eb5dd8/kombu/connection.py#L356
and https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/85c191a48ace265836bbce39a2c8a5fab98833b8/kombu/utils/functional.py#L331
prove it.

Change-Id: I11811f9f04a9615d226fc2e24a4078a9618f766f
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust help text of config option rabbit_max_retries

The annotation the link of
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/b0947e57138b97ef18f1451aa900bd476490e502/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py#L684
shows that if rabbit_max_retries = 0, there is no retry
to connect to rabbitmq after disconnection.

In the kombu lib, this two links https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/d9340c1f3b6660c596ee35eba943336e91eb5dd8/kombu/connection.py#L356
and https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/85c191a48ace265836bbce39a2c8a5fab98833b8/kombu/utils/functional.py#L331
prove it.

Change-Id: I11811f9f04a9615d226fc2e24a4078a9618f766f

objects for router route  which has db models definition and mixins

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 08:17:59.000000000', 'files': ['etc/panko/api_paste.ini'], 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Panko. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Panko.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ifa9dad55cfedeb8b804d675d3d4856af6096b039
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 90faa85ecc6cc4e6875c5cb14285f20104830b69)
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Panko. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Panko.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ifa9dad55cfedeb8b804d675d3d4856af6096b039
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 90faa85ecc6cc4e6875c5cb14285f20104830b69)

commit_message:
Fix js validation of the password in dynamic UI

Before this patch clicking on an eye icon disabled javascript
validation of the password. I added to password field
the attribute 'data-type=password' and in js changed
the selector to include new attribute in the selector,
that attaches the check function.

Change-Id: Ic7e57814a68c315e570c120f31febdada73079a7
Closes-Bug: #1567859

better to use sys.maxsize.
https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.0.html#integers

Change-Id: I5af1537ae04a16454f20040e01ec64a6454171a2
Closes-Bug: #1628830

Ironic is flexible for x86/x86_64 servers by supporting BIOS and UEFI.
But to deploy servers of other architectures, such as aarch64 or ppc64,
configuration(PXE boot file and config template) must be modified,
which means one Ironic conductor can only deploy baremetal machines of

commit_message:
Support multi arch deployment

Ironic is flexible for x86/x86_64 servers by supporting BIOS and UEFI.
But to deploy servers of other architectures, such as aarch64 or ppc64,
configuration(PXE boot file and config template) must be modified,
which means one Ironic conductor can only deploy baremetal machines of
one architecture.

This patch adds multi arch deployment support. For example, to deploy
x86_64 and aarch64 servers by one Ironic conductor.

Closes-Bug: #1582964

Change-Id: I628320aeb44b232a262d0843bc726a68d297e1f8

Meltsaykin', 'email': 'dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmeltsaykin'}, {'_account_id': 14689, 'name': 'Vitaly Sedelnik', 'email': 'vitaly.sedelnik@canonical.com', 'username': 'vsedelnik'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18290, 'name': 'Kyrylo Galanov', 'email': 'kgalanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kgalanov'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23092, 'name': 'Anton Chevychalov', 'email': 'pub@mnu.pp.ru', 'username': 'achevychalov'}, {'_account_id': 23117, 'name': 'DSS Cinder CI', 'email': 'budik_06@list.ru', 'username': 'DSSCinderCI', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-26 16:50:38.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-docker-utils/functions.sh'], 'message': 'Fix dockerctl backup logic to remove double pausing

This commit changes logic of pausing containers to prevent trying
to pause already paused containers.
If container was running before backup it will be paused and than unpaused.
If container was paused before backup it will stay paused after backup.

Change-Id: I78f428660366932b34002cd9985be79df8162c38
Closes-Bug: #1603842
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dockerctl backup logic to remove double pausing

This commit changes logic of pausing containers to prevent trying
to pause already paused containers.
If container was running before backup it will be paused and than unpaused.
If container was paused before backup it will stay paused after backup.

Change-Id: I78f428660366932b34002cd9985be79df8162c38
Closes-Bug: #1603842

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 06:02:34.000000000', 'files': ['etc/aodh/api_paste.ini'], 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Aodh. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Aodh.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: If2ada8a94c8e1ceacd4509605b4cd766a78f71d5
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 0f2a80d8efb86faea7ee94d7eb744bb66ad79ba9)
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Aodh. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Aodh.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: If2ada8a94c8e1ceacd4509605b4cd766a78f71d5
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 0f2a80d8efb86faea7ee94d7eb744bb66ad79ba9)

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Ceilometer. The

case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Ceilometer.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the

Ceilometer, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

Change-Id: I24f16dda49bd9e7930ca9f0d32bf0793463aff03

(cherry picked from commit 30eb0f0ae16c7ffd0f90c3874d3cbc462d5863a0)

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Ceilometer. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Ceilometer.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Ceilometer, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: I24f16dda49bd9e7930ca9f0d32bf0793463aff03
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 30eb0f0ae16c7ffd0f90c3874d3cbc462d5863a0)

commit_message:
Use ryu to parse error message

Given the comment in [1], ryu can be used to parse some OFPErrorMsg.
DF can use it. Since the error message is redundant, it is OK to just
parse some of the error message. An example output is at [2]

[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/585267/

subject: Skip CentOS7 jobs for OSA OpenStack service repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 08:15:52.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Skip CentOS7 jobs for OSA OpenStack service repositories

Skip any OpenStack-Ansible jobs for os_ repositories which run on
CentOS7 except os_keystone, os_glance, os_cinder for stable/newton.

CentOS7 support is ongoing. While many repositories have CentOS7
support and jobs to validate this, we need to skip these jobs for
most of the OpenStack (ie os_*) repositories as they do not yet have
the supporting code in stable/newton but are gaining it in master.

Change-Id: I7f74834fd87ed07fcec86bf9dec2ea20ea5c5b48
'}]
commit_message:
Skip CentOS7 jobs for OSA OpenStack service repositories

Skip any OpenStack-Ansible jobs for os_ repositories which run on
CentOS7 except os_keystone, os_glance, os_cinder for stable/newton.

CentOS7 support is ongoing. While many repositories have CentOS7
support and jobs to validate this, we need to skip these jobs for
most of the OpenStack (ie os_*) repositories as they do not yet have
the supporting code in stable/newton but are gaining it in master.

Change-Id: I7f74834fd87ed07fcec86bf9dec2ea20ea5c5b48

commit_message:
Make Cinder multinode grenade job voting

In order for Cinder to achieve assert:supports-rolling-upgrade tag, we
need a voting job that's testing version compatibility. This commit
switches Cinder's multinode grenade job to voting.

Change-Id: If55890b97056762e4d5b3f850b3971b30dd96662

commit_message:
Updates for switch to reactive charm model

tempest, openvswitch-odl and neutron-api-odl charms have switched to
using reactive and charm layers; update job definitions inline with
other reactive charms to ensure that python3 tests are executed.

Drop all python34-jobs entries from zuul layout as these are no
longer executed.

commit_message:
Retire some wrong deb-os-* and deb-oslo*

These repositories are duplicate of deb-python-* (which matches the
source package name uploaded to Debian). They were wrongly added to
packaging-deb.

This patch is the intial step to remove the packages as per the
instructions at http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html.

Our appologies for the time loss with this.

Change-Id: Ie5dab06b847490340669bdd09c494f09a8e81e87

commit_message:
Fix sahara gate: failure in tempest config options access

As Tempest removed the Sahara tests which are available in
sahara tempest plugin, CONF.data_processing attr is not
available to access the configuration options needed
for sahara tempest tests.

Plugin should set the whatever attribute they would like to access
their registered config options.

Tempest plugin framework do register all options and its upto
plugin how they like to access the config options.

Change-Id: I363ed9a3e0c4d45b04dc3b71bf1b0a21e7668584
Closes-Bug: #1632895

subject: Test: make enforce_type=True in conf.set_override
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-05 01:29:22.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/functional/gabbi/fixtures.py', 'ceilometer/tests/base.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/hardware/pollsters/test_generic.py'], 'message': "Test: make enforce_type=True in conf.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method conf.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method conf.set_override with enforce_type=True.

Change-Id: Ie45841737384453e716260381b60478490df4dfb
Closes-Bug: #1517839
"}]
commit_message:
Test: make enforce_type=True in conf.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method conf.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method conf.set_override with enforce_type=True.

Change-Id: Ie45841737384453e716260381b60478490df4dfb
Closes-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
tests: fix tests for functional tests without dsvm

Currently functional tests pass in gate just because some calls are
done on real devstack, and passed by chance. We don't need dsvm at all
with pifpaf.

This change fixes this tests and add bindep.txt file for new gate jobs
without dsvm will be setup to ensure this doesn't happen again.

The tox targets pyXX-psql are renamed pyXX-postgresql to match all other jobs names.

Change-Id: I0e6cfb71cc53a47a11a12b5797fe262f9211ce22

commit_message:
Fix container log bind mount regression

The container bind mount for all logs was being skipped due to a logic
bug. This fixes the bug while also maintaining the functionality to omit
log bind mounts when the variable `default_bind_mount_logs` is set to
"false".

Closes-Bug: #1632818
Change-Id: If9433d6280a3940c25fc0af714313d2caa265df6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add new project hurricane

This project will be a one-stop-shop for interconnecting
stackstorm and openstack and providing packs, tools and
integrated scripts and templates (and more) that allow for
stackstorm and openstack to integrate nicely (in a way that
also helps operators get the most bang for the buck).

LP @ https://launchpad.net/hurricane

What stackstorm is:

https://stackstorm.com/

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 08:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['etc/panko/api_paste.ini'], 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Panko. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Panko.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ifa9dad55cfedeb8b804d675d3d4856af6096b039
Closes-Bug: #1590608
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Panko. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Panko.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ifa9dad55cfedeb8b804d675d3d4856af6096b039
Closes-Bug: #1590608

subject: Ensure GetLastError gets called in the right thread
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 10:26:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/utils/test_win32utils.py', 'os_win/utils/win32utils.py'], 'message': "Ensure GetLastError gets called in the right thread

Recently, we've started invoking Win32 API functions in different
threads in order to avoid blocking other greenthreads.

The only issue is that if a function fails, we're retrieving the
error code by calling GetLastError from the original thread, thus
retrieving wrong error codes.

This change ensures that the subsequent error handling will be
performed in the same thread as the invoked function.

Change-Id: Id54b5bdb8e4561aaa42164b8c5d52a1a83da7149
Closes-Bug: #1632297
(cherry picked from commit b9d5d0b18b2492a5a4d43f3a7c2754c6d0e20429)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure GetLastError gets called in the right thread

Recently, we've started invoking Win32 API functions in different
threads in order to avoid blocking other greenthreads.

The only issue is that if a function fails, we're retrieving the
error code by calling GetLastError from the original thread, thus
retrieving wrong error codes.

This change ensures that the subsequent error handling will be
performed in the same thread as the invoked function.

Change-Id: Id54b5bdb8e4561aaa42164b8c5d52a1a83da7149
Closes-Bug: #1632297
(cherry picked from commit b9d5d0b18b2492a5a4d43f3a7c2754c6d0e20429)

commit_message:
Add option to enable Gnocchi's SSL middleware

Gnocchi is now using the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware from
oslo.middlware in its default api-paste configuration [1]. This commit
gives us the ability to enable/disable that middlware.

[1] Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129

Change-Id: Iae5f9d56970ae930294eeae34928061a6b434095

commit_message:
Fix old.fuellib_review_syntax_check fails for cobbler and nailgun

A latest puppet-lint version installed on CI server is used to
run old.fuellib_review_syntax_check for cobbler and nailgun
modules. As a result, we are checking stable code against latest
linting rules and getting new errors.

I have pinned puppet-lint version for rake lint checks for cobbler
and nailgun modules to fix current problem with dash checks.

Change-Id: Ida8e65a6ab64083b6f7bb4bd7db00618ffda9d57
Partial-bug: #1629859

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 06:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['etc/gnocchi/api-paste.ini'], 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 2b1ed8d4528df8c3071343d1cd5764b6a7122fd1)
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 2b1ed8d4528df8c3071343d1cd5764b6a7122fd1)

subject: Configure Calico specific BIRD settings in OSA
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 01:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/neutron_calico_dhcp_agent.yml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Configure Calico specific BIRD settings in OSA

In an effort to decouple the upstream BIRD role from Calico's specific
use-case, the role no longer configures BGP peers by default as of tag
1.1. We should insert some example BGP peers into the group vars so that
a deployer using Calico will receive some base BGP peer configuration
in their hypervisors.

This is essentially deploying the same configuration that was already
being deployed to BIRD, however the Calico specific defaults will now
reside in OSA.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385573/

Change-Id: Ic0ece84f259d0e72f79fedbd8a90fcc691f03229
(cherry picked from commit 0b164143691be4b8403b198f575d617ac01f7b3a)
"}]
commit_message:
Configure Calico specific BIRD settings in OSA

In an effort to decouple the upstream BIRD role from Calico's specific
use-case, the role no longer configures BGP peers by default as of tag
1.1. We should insert some example BGP peers into the group vars so that
a deployer using Calico will receive some base BGP peer configuration
in their hypervisors.

This is essentially deploying the same configuration that was already
being deployed to BIRD, however the Calico specific defaults will now
reside in OSA.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385573/

Change-Id: Ic0ece84f259d0e72f79fedbd8a90fcc691f03229
(cherry picked from commit 0b164143691be4b8403b198f575d617ac01f7b3a)

commit_message:
Update amulet test definitions for Newton

- Remove Precise-Icehouse Amulet test definitions if they exist.

- Add Xenial-Newton Amulet test definitions, using ODL BE.

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions, using ODL BE.

- Use the percona-cluster charm in tests instead of the mysql charm.

- Also adjust py hash bangs to use env python.

Closes-Bug: 1632533

Change-Id: If10e49a9c45bc7fcd1eb073dcdccabed6c37a958

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_success

This replaces usage of mox with mock and also adds mocking of the
FixedIntervalLoopingCall in the test as there was a race on whether
or not _wait_for_snapshot and subsequently _volume_api.get_snapshot
would be called by the time the call assertion of get_snapshot
was made.

This was uncovered when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315241/
replaced mox with mock in completely different tests and
test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_success began failing when run
in parallel with other tests. When run alone, it passed.

Part of blueprint remove-mox-newton


This is a series of original backports and their dependencies
for stable/mitaka for resolving the bug #1405533.

Required backports:
1) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329425/
2) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329422/

Backport dependencies:
1) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329421/
2) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329294/
3) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329287/
4) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329280/

Change-Id: I4952f5cb3a3765ea0dee4a2a38483b6434d65ce6
(cherry picked from commit 4e5d6451378de58147ec8e2eb645c9edc416b5aa)

commit_message:
[Manila] Use only xenial nodes for newton+ branches

Remove 'ubuntu-trusty' jobs from usage with master and
stable/newton branches, as they now support 'ubuntu-xenial' ([1], [2]).

Also, enable 'gate-manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-dummy-ubuntu-xenial'
CI job as voting.

[1] I7e6aee341981b8305f993a5b8030b7104dc650b4
[2] Ie40c0517096420ce41e387dce41e5952fa417056

Change-Id: I6cff094284d1cc5ff0d669a969dc2f32a034c18c

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 06:25:31.000000000', 'files': ['etc/gnocchi/api-paste.ini'], 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129
Closes-Bug: #1590608
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129
Closes-Bug: #1590608

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Ceilometer. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Ceilometer.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Ceilometer, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: I24f16dda49bd9e7930ca9f0d32bf0793463aff03
Closes-Bug: #1590608

commit_message:
test: rewrite test_post_unix_timestamp in Gabbi

The test is actually poorly written as it uses a string rather than a
float. There's no reason that the test should pass, even if it does.

The real test that we need passing is a float, not a string parseable
with a float.

Change-Id: I6bf9df329e434bd477612780544813d1107b51c1

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Aodh. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Aodh.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

This was already used in the API endpoint, but it's also needed in

header (or Proxy protocol if used) and set the protocol as directed

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware to Heat CFN endpoint

This was already used in the API endpoint, but it's also needed in
the CFN endpoint. It's purpose is to process the X-Forwarded-Proto
header (or Proxy protocol if used) and set the protocol as directed
to https if done so. It's only needed if Heat is behind a TLS proxy
(such as HAProxy) and is also disabled by default.

Change-Id: Ibd81e1cf6bc1e3f63728b485e295478afa7f573c
Closes-Bug: #1590608

subject: Use --version-map when generating constraints updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-06 05:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_update.sh'], 'message': "Use --version-map when generating constraints updates

We need to generate constraints for all python versions we use.  This is
python 2.7 (trusty and xenial), 3.4 (trusty) and 3.5(xenial).  The best
way to do that is run generate-constraints with all 3 versions of python
and have it sort out the freeze.

This is difficult as there isn't a trivial way to have all 3 versions of
python available, and building from source on the proposal node is too
intrusive.

Use a --version-map that allows us to clone the output of a freeze
between python versions.  This assumes that the python version in
question are compatible during the transition window.

This will mean that we generate constraints consistently between
versions regardless of which version /usr/bin/python3 is.

Change-Id: I1a0122407a1edd8b828465780b3e7bd0d1b719d3
Depends-On: I55a3597ea2f2bf48e30dc564a4bf4b2ef7f178b3
"}]
commit_message:
Use --version-map when generating constraints updates

We need to generate constraints for all python versions we use.  This is
python 2.7 (trusty and xenial), 3.4 (trusty) and 3.5(xenial).  The best
way to do that is run generate-constraints with all 3 versions of python
and have it sort out the freeze.

This is difficult as there isn't a trivial way to have all 3 versions of
python available, and building from source on the proposal node is too
intrusive.

Use a --version-map that allows us to clone the output of a freeze
between python versions.  This assumes that the python version in
question are compatible during the transition window.

This will mean that we generate constraints consistently between
versions regardless of which version /usr/bin/python3 is.

Change-Id: I1a0122407a1edd8b828465780b3e7bd0d1b719d3
Depends-On: I55a3597ea2f2bf48e30dc564a4bf4b2ef7f178b3

subject: Change the common proxy cache manage tasks to be stateful
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-12 23:43:57.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/package-cache-proxy.yml'], 'message': 'Change the common proxy cache manage tasks to be stateful

In certain situation the proxy cache manager may be down, misconfigured,
or otherwise not available. To ensure a consistent environment and give
the deployer a better build experience, especially in the case of an
AIO, the proxy cache common task has been changed to test for cache
availability and add/remove the cache files based on that test.

Change-Id: Ibd0186d67a844ec7b79f423adfb8104d13f72ca5
Closes-Bug: #1632826
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Change the common proxy cache manage tasks to be stateful

In certain situation the proxy cache manager may be down, misconfigured,
or otherwise not available. To ensure a consistent environment and give
the deployer a better build experience, especially in the case of an
AIO, the proxy cache common task has been changed to test for cache
availability and add/remove the cache files based on that test.

Change-Id: Ibd0186d67a844ec7b79f423adfb8104d13f72ca5
Closes-Bug: #1632826
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update doc to have 'debootstrap' dep and describe minimal

Update the doc, that explains how to use disk-image-builder to create an
image, to have an additional dependency on 'debootstrap'

Also remove DISTRO= line from example as it was confusing and would make
people not build the ubuntu-minimal image.

Add a little info on the -minimal build types.

When the last volume has been deleted from the Storage

deleted off the array, but the code is throwing up an

Change-Id: I79559789459f73c4adebf010d84cbeedd25f7f74

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Cleanup of Initiator group fails

When the last volume has been deleted from the Storage
Group and the Masking View has been deleted and the
initiator group is no longer in use, the deletion of
the Initiator group fails. The initiator group is actually
deleted off the array, but the code is throwing up an
error when it uses the now deleted initiator group
name to search for remaining masking views. The
solution is to check if the initiator group has been
deleted by common.terminate_connection before searching
for remaining masking views.

Change-Id: I79559789459f73c4adebf010d84cbeedd25f7f74
Closes-Bug: #1605193
(cherry picked from commit 8e62557f6e6608ab415d5d172caa88f3033a86a0)

subject: Throttle update_auditor_status calls
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-12 07:14:05.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Throttle update_auditor_status calls

If there are quite a few nearly empty partitions per disk you might see
some write load even if your cluster is unused. The auditor will update
the status file after every partition, and this might happen multiple
times within a second if there is not much data stored yet.

This patch throttles updates, and will only write out an updated status
if the file was last updated more than a minute ago.

Closes-Bug: 1631352
Change-Id: Ib61ec9cd945e6b2d28756f6ca47801674a7e6060
'}]
commit_message:
Throttle update_auditor_status calls

If there are quite a few nearly empty partitions per disk you might see
some write load even if your cluster is unused. The auditor will update
the status file after every partition, and this might happen multiple
times within a second if there is not much data stored yet.

This patch throttles updates, and will only write out an updated status
if the file was last updated more than a minute ago.

Closes-Bug: 1631352
Change-Id: Ib61ec9cd945e6b2d28756f6ca47801674a7e6060

commit_message:
journal: filter.py: AttributeError: 'NoneType'

The following stack trace occurs.
L3 plugin logs None as http body in journal entry.
So _populate_project_id_and_tenant_id needs to be aware of it.
Otherwise it tries to manipulate on None and trigger following
stack trace.

> ERROR networking_odl.journal.journal [-] Error on run_sync_thread
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal Traceback (most recent call last):
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal   File "/opt/stack/networking-odl/networking_odl/journal/journal.py", line 153, in run_sync_thread
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal     self._sync_pending_rows(session, exit_after_run)
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal   File "/opt/stack/networking-odl/networking_odl/journal/journal.py", line 192, in _sync_pending_rows
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal     method, urlpath, to_send = self._json_data(row)
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal   File "/opt/stack/networking-odl/networking_odl/journal/journal.py", line 128, in _json_data
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal     filters.filter_for_odl(row.object_type, row.operation, data)
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal   File "/opt/stack/networking-odl/networking_odl/common/filters.py", line 160, in filter_for_odl
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal     _populate_project_id_and_tenant_id(data)
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal   File "/opt/stack/networking-odl/networking_odl/common/filters.py", line 33, in _populate_project_id_and_tenant_id
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal     project_id = resource_dict.get('project_id',
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'
> TRACE networking_odl.journal.journal

Change-Id: I66c8772fcb58cbf96da06aacae553d007b44ca7f
Closes-Bug: #1632176

commit_message:
Improve README

networking-odl no longer will just be a driver to connect
ml2 OpenStack Neutron with OpenDayLight, it is becoming more
like integration of OpenStack Neutron resource API with OpenDaylight
so added more relevant info and arranged links in README.rst

Change-Id: Iabd7113d1bdd0f4c83e8ef44fffafdfbe5583f1d

subject: Fix typo in DB migration script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 21:25:42.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/contract/fa0c536252a5_update_opendayligut_journal.py'], 'message': 'Fix typo in DB migration script

There was a typo in Ie40dedca75f695edeed7f0b29a9a01daeead2bc0 .

We noticed it because networking-bgpvpn runs DB migration scripts
from its test dependencies and this typo is breaking our gate.

We would encourage you to adopt unit test that exercise the
DB migration script, like the one in I24d35f7dccab611143f4b0a7428ba7074f2adcc2 .

Change-Id: Iede630d4ad1b0de63bc12696b95dc3e2fccc1358
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in DB migration script

There was a typo in Ie40dedca75f695edeed7f0b29a9a01daeead2bc0 .

We noticed it because networking-bgpvpn runs DB migration scripts
from its test dependencies and this typo is breaking our gate.

We would encourage you to adopt unit test that exercise the
DB migration script, like the one in I24d35f7dccab611143f4b0a7428ba7074f2adcc2 .

Change-Id: Iede630d4ad1b0de63bc12696b95dc3e2fccc1358

commit_message:
Manila install guide: Fix wrong instructions

Previously only the DHSS=True mode was documented
in post install steps. The assumption that the generic driver
was being configured existed in other places as well.

* add DHSS=False documentation as necessary with the
   LVM driver.
* correct assumptions in other places to clarify usage
   of appropriate share driver modes.

Change-Id: Ic1356453e510e8f360269fb45a41379329ce68c2
Closes-Bug: #1616257

commit_message:
modify description of "Inject guest networking config"

The description of "Inject guest networking config" in
support-matrix is misleading. Correct it.
In fact, If we config static ip,
guest os can not access metadata service to get ip config.
Closes-Bug: #1612913

Change-Id: I1892e5273a77516dd8e1525e6064fb95fa65e4d3

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-10-07 20:52:23.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/dispatcher/test_gnocchi.py', 'etc/ceilometer/gnocchi_resources.yaml', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi.py'], 'message': 'make gnocchi event dispatcher work

The gnocchi event dispatcher have been broken by two major changes
because of no tests coverage (requests->gnocchiclient and panko
refactoring)

To fix that:
* the event dispatcher class derive the base event dispatcher class.
* Use correct gnocchi client method to search resources.
* Use correct gnocchi client method to update resources.
* Since record_event received a raw notification now and no more the event,
  we change the parsing codetoo.
* And obviously add a test !

Change-Id: I94b7393d79e495c5101225b4097c7073978ca7d7
Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: 1627928
'}]
commit_message:
make gnocchi event dispatcher work

The gnocchi event dispatcher have been broken by two major changes
because of no tests coverage (requests->gnocchiclient and panko
refactoring)

To fix that:
* the event dispatcher class derive the base event dispatcher class.
* Use correct gnocchi client method to search resources.
* Use correct gnocchi client method to update resources.
* Since record_event received a raw notification now and no more the event,
  we change the parsing codetoo.
* And obviously add a test !

Change-Id: I94b7393d79e495c5101225b4097c7073978ca7d7
Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: 1627928

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-12 23:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Make default domain id match actual default

The default keystone domain id is "default", all lower-case, with
a name of "Default".  Due to the backport of
I028b2add3067e6fb9aa3f33eb8fe10d8ebace006 this case mismatch now
causes authentication to fail on a Mitaka cloud deployed with
Puppet.

This is being submitted directly to mitaka because newton and newer
use os_service_default for these values, so there should be no
changes needed there.

Change-Id: Ifb13cd3654c2435ead2c4c8cfd73d093943adbc2
Closes-Bug: 1631319
'}]
commit_message:
Make default domain id match actual default

The default keystone domain id is "default", all lower-case, with
a name of "Default".  Due to the backport of
I028b2add3067e6fb9aa3f33eb8fe10d8ebace006 this case mismatch now
causes authentication to fail on a Mitaka cloud deployed with
Puppet.

This is being submitted directly to mitaka because newton and newer
use os_service_default for these values, so there should be no
changes needed there.

Change-Id: Ifb13cd3654c2435ead2c4c8cfd73d093943adbc2
Closes-Bug: 1631319

Use asserts with more specific assert methods, e.g.: from
assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*),
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

This change ensures a better description will be shown on fail. This is
the recommended way to use assertions provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Ia4a34e0145176e077bbf7e9ed6f69d815c6ed840
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Use asserts with more specific assert methods, e.g.: from
assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*),
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

This change ensures a better description will be shown on fail. This is
the recommended way to use assertions provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Ia4a34e0145176e077bbf7e9ed6f69d815c6ed840
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
metricd: fix a data type inconsistent bug

The variable 'self.previously_scheduled_metrics'
initially is Set type, afterwards it is assigned
a List type data ('metrics'), this causes the
error:

  2016-09-20 17:14:27.919 28772 ERROR gnocchi.cli TypeError: unsupported
  operand type(s) for -: 'set' and 'list'

Change-Id: Iec5ab651d82fdd8d058f8a3232a6cd93df1e3cf5
Closes-Bug: #1625529

commit_message:
Remove dbus packages installed in trusty defaults

These packages are here becuase they've been here forever there is no
reason that they're needed and they cause issues for the neutron agents
on trusty in the Newton release when run under overlayfs thus they've
been removed.

Change-Id: I6be96b7cb79a996af06f1daa0cb6dfc9efc616ea
Closes-Bug: #1631690
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix the intermittent of fullstack failure

The allowed address pair ties with port by using sql relationship in
neutron db, there is no guarantee of the order for it.

This patch changes the assert in test to comply it.

Change-Id: I1545aeff3ebf4edce80a8074bf5c8acdda8739cc

commit_message:
devstack: call odl-ovs-hostconfig conditionally

neutron-odl-ovs-hostconfig requires ovs 2.5+.
On the other hand, openstack CI with ubuntu-trusty includes older
ovs version.
So invoke neutron-odl-ovs-hostconfig only when pseudo-agentdb-binding
is specified. Otherwise don't call it because it's not necessary.

Change-Id: Ic58b91252b68d5d66d18ff09ae44ced8669ec815
Closes-Bug: #1632873

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 12261, 'name': 'Mahati', 'email': 'mahati.chamarthy@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mahati'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-10 17:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/common.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'doc/source/overview_erasure_code.rst', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync.py', 'test/probe/test_reconstructor_durable.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_receiver.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': "EC - eliminate .durable files

Instead of using a separate .durable file to indicate
the durable status of a .data file, rename the .data
to include a durable marker in the filename. This saves
one inode for every EC fragment archive.

An EC policy PUT will, as before, first rename a temp
file to:

   <timestamp>#<frag_index>.data

but now, when the object is committed, that file will be
renamed:

   <timestamp>#<frag_index>#d.data

with the '#d' suffix marking the data file as durable.

Diskfile suffix hashing returns the same result when the
new durable-data filename or the legacy durable file is
found in an object directory. A fragment archive that has
been created on an upgraded object server will therefore
appear to be in the same state, as far as the consistency
engine is concerned, as the same fragment archive created
on an older object server.

Since legacy .durable files will still exist in deployed
clusters, many of the unit tests scenarios have been
duplicated for both new durable-data filenames and legacy
durable files.

Change-Id: I6f1f62d47be0b0ac7919888c77480a636f11f607
"}]
commit_message:
EC - eliminate .durable files

Instead of using a separate .durable file to indicate
the durable status of a .data file, rename the .data
to include a durable marker in the filename. This saves
one inode for every EC fragment archive.

An EC policy PUT will, as before, first rename a temp
file to:

   <timestamp>#<frag_index>.data

but now, when the object is committed, that file will be
renamed:

   <timestamp>#<frag_index>#d.data

with the '#d' suffix marking the data file as durable.

Diskfile suffix hashing returns the same result when the
new durable-data filename or the legacy durable file is
found in an object directory. A fragment archive that has
been created on an upgraded object server will therefore
appear to be in the same state, as far as the consistency
engine is concerned, as the same fragment archive created
on an older object server.

Since legacy .durable files will still exist in deployed
clusters, many of the unit tests scenarios have been
duplicated for both new durable-data filenames and legacy
durable files.

Change-Id: I6f1f62d47be0b0ac7919888c77480a636f11f607

subject: Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1531, 'name': 'Ilya Kharin', 'email': 'akscram@gmail.com', 'username': 'akscram'}, {'_account_id': 6677, 'name': 'Oleg Gelbukh', 'email': 'ogelbukh@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gelbuhos'}, {'_account_id': 9588, 'name': 'Sergey Novikov', 'email': 'snovikov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'snovikov'}, {'_account_id': 12559, 'name': 'Valyavskiy Viacheslav', 'email': 'vvalyavskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vvalyavskiy'}, {'_account_id': 15984, 'name': 'Vladimir Khlyunev', 'email': 'vkhlyunev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkhlyunev'}, {'_account_id': 19119, 'name': 'Alexey Stepanov', 'email': 'penguinolog@ik.me', 'username': 'penguinolog'}, {'_account_id': 19157, 'name': 'Sergey Abramov', 'email': 'sabramov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sabramov'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 04:26:29.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/generate_test_nets.py', 'octane/util/db.py', 'octane/util/deployment.py', 'octane/util/docker.py', 'octane/commands/osd_upgrade.py', 'octane/util/network.py', 'octane/util/nova.py'], 'message': "Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: I3bf2efe0685e183a63204925a18008b554fc2110
"}]
commit_message:
Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: I3bf2efe0685e183a63204925a18008b554fc2110

subject: Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 05:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_http_models.py'], 'message': "Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Ibff55ef5dfd96c71c5a0c413fd636632af700779
"}]
commit_message:
Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Ibff55ef5dfd96c71c5a0c413fd636632af700779
